Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed to find that the customer service here was awful. I was told a different price on the phone than when I arrived. I never received a confirmation email and when I was talking to the front desk attendant about this he was incredibly rude and smug. THe room was alright but smelled and was in a location by the pool and the lobby so there was a lot of noise. The location seemed a little sketchy and was pretty far from Smathers and Duval. They do have a shuttle running to both places but the one to the beach runs only every hour and the one to Duval stops at 12. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately go back for great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Nancy A
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out and breakfast all employees were most helpful and attentive to our needs. Key West is a week-end rest for us and we were treated great. Nancy Astete

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: petra m
Reviews.Content: There were two guys at the front desk who barely said hello. I think the guy was chatting or something on his computer. The concierge was not there, so we went back in a different time and the desk guy looked bothered having to stop whatever he was doing on his computer to tell us where she was. She had gone to another hotel, so we had to walk there to find her. The rooms are old (brownish spots on the bathtub)... I was woken up at 4:30 in the morning because of an alarm somebody had set previously. There was also a rooster outside our door making sounds for hours since five oclock and nobody cared. If you make a reservation make sure you tell them in advance if you want to pay cash or be charged on another card, because they will charge the card you used for the reservation. Also, they have extra charges that they don't mention on their web.

Reviews.Title: “Great shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: AwesomelyKristy
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel; however it is a great value for Key West. The hotel recently started a shuttle that takes you down town every 15 minutes and to the beach every hour. I'm glad I booked this hotel because I could use the money I saved for seeing the sights and enjoying the great restaurants. Great Value!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Help”
Reviews.Author: vacationcolette
Reviews.Content: We appreciated Elena at the front desk who found us a ground floor room by the pool that was more accessible for my handicapped husband. Marcia in housekeeping was helpful when my room door wouldn't open and in keeping the towels coming. The pool setting was lovely which made up for the lack of ocean view and location next to a Trolley Station very convenient. The staff and other guests had the "Key West Vibe."

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khan H
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here; room had 2 double beds and it was clean. Shower was broken and not much to expect. It was like a motel however.

Reviews.Title: “Worked good for us”
Reviews.Author: MstqMI
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here while visiting Key West and we were pleased. We did have a problem with the shower on the first morning- my husband told the hotel clerk and it was fixed by the time we got back that evening. The concierge was very helpful with finding a parking lot downtown and with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: AKdreaming
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, the outside a bit run down and the bathrooms outdated and in need of work. However we found the staff friendly, the hotel very clean and the beds very comfortable. The location was great for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & value!”
Reviews.Author: solfetch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Key West. This was the 10th year to visit the island but the first at this hotel. What a pleasant surprise. Very nice room, excellent hotel staff, wonderful breakfast (not just muffins & coffee - REAL food). Highly recommend it. Close to Old Town. I must add that there was a dying roach on the bathroom floor but that is the only negative I can find.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast bar and area very nice.”
Reviews.Author: ThePaiges
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed a couple of nights at this facility. The free parking was important for parking during the nights. During the day we were able to find parking in the old town part of the island. The breakfast bar was good with a lot of choices and there were tables outside and inside. Very pleasant. The room was very clean and the bed really comfortable. The only thing I would improve is the availability of refrigerators. We requested one but were told that they didn't have any more available.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there unless you are a gambler”
Reviews.Author: Hemanth K
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience in my life. Did not read reviews before I booked, mistake. Checked in, dropped off our stuff and went sight-seeing. Got back at night and wanted to take a shower. No water from the shower. Called front desk, a plumber came shortly. He checks the shower, dismantles knobs, faucets etc. After 20mins or so, he is walking out of the room (we are very much in the room) without saying a word. I ask him at the door if the shower is fixed and he says yes and he is gone. I go check the shower, water is now coming from the shower, but barely. Not even an idiot would say you can take a bath with water dribbling from that shower. It is past 11pm and we have an early morning snorkling trip booked. We weigh our options of calling the front desk and getting the same guy come again, obviously that shower was not going to work and then trying to get our room changed. After the long day we had driving and early morning plans we decided to go to bed without a shower. In the morning, I went to inform the front desk of the incident. The lady at the front desk (Marina Banciu) did not even blink an eyelid when I said the shower was not working. (Did not seem like an isolated incident to me) Next she asks me why I did not call again if it was not repaired. I told her, we did not want to have a whole drama late into the night. I just want to make sure that they were aware of both the room condition and also the way the maintenance staff responded. She said she cannot do anything since we did not call the night before. It seemed like the whole thing was somehow our problem. She never even apologized for giving us a room in that condition for $250 (Not fun, it was our 20th anniversary). I took her card, vacated the room and sent a feedback to their website, saying it appears front desk does not even feel it necessary to apologize for the incident nor offer to check why the staff behaved that way. Best part I get a call and it is the same lady. She now apologizes 6 times on the call and says she checked with the staff and he says it was repaired. Unbelievable! Not a single towel was touched in the room and I wonder if she now thinks that I am lying too. Wow! Iasked her if they had any checklist before clearing rooms for customers. She said they had, but could not explain why it did not work. There is no escape, no one else you can talk to. If there is no room available in the other hotels on Key west, I recommend you book a room in hotels on other islands. They are not far at all and it is a plesant drive in any case. Location is good and you may get away with a room with a working shower, but the hotel is very old (later I saw the patch work on walls and botched paintwork etc.) If you have a problem and a good chance you might), you are screwed. Simply not worth it. Pay attention to other reviews. Shows a pattern.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANNIE33324
Reviews.Content: An average value for money hotel.clean rooms.gud room service. has breakfast buffet service till 10. Travel desk at the reception is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here for the price”
Reviews.Author: kab16
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Quality Inn we have ever stayed at and the most expensive. Of course that makes it cheap for Key West. It awful place. Old and badly maintained. The beds were saggy, the shower leaked and flooded the bathroom, the carpets dreadful. The wallpaper patched. The hallways with holes in the ceilings. We didn't bother to eat the free breakfast but went to the Denny's next door which was much more pleasant. This hotel is very inconvenient for downtown which is 3 miles away and requires an exit into busy traffic if driving. It was a $20 cab ride to Duval St and the trolley service I had seen mentioned only runs 9 -5. There is a bicycle rental next door and what seemed to be pleasant trails along the water. There are also several kayak rentals just across the bridge on route 1 where you can kayak through the mangroves. The hotel does have a 'concierge' and they were very helpful although they were trying to sell trips. There must be better value in Key West than this awful place. The Comfort Inn next door certainly seemed to be in better repair.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_d_12_12
Reviews.Content: We came for 1 day and stayed for 3. We found this place in a Roomsavers book and loved it. The room was very clean as were the grownds. The pool was well kept and bathwater warm. They served a nice breakfast with food fresh and plentyful. All staff was quick to respond to any concerns / questions and always pleasant. I highly recomend when looking for a moderate price hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort in noisy Key West”
Reviews.Author: DickandLynn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Quality Inn in noisy and crowded Key West at the height of the tourist season. You arrive at the hotel as you turn off the highway from the keys and it is right across from the water. It is on the outskirts of the city, not right down in town so you have to take the trolley or rent a bike or scooter, or dive in to find parking in this very crowded place. It is an older building, but clean and cozy. The staff, especially Denis at the desk, went out of their way to be friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was good. The price was right for Key West which has many overpriced hotels. We recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bath Tub”
Reviews.Author: ES200
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the beds were made, but the tub was the dirtiest tub I have ever seen and there were dirty towels left in the bathroom. For $200 (January 1st and 2nd) I expected something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “If this were a $79 hotel it would have been a good deal”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRalph
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be in Key West at the height of the tourist season , I admit. Nothing else was available when we booked about 3 weeks ago. But $279 for this room was a gouge. The hotel is very old with few if any amenities. It would have been a great bargain at $79, or even $179, but for the price we paid, keep looking if you have any other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: Hardolin
Reviews.Content: The room is pretty clean. Staff was very nice. The breakfast was good and very helpful to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: Geno58
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Stayed 2 nights, didn't get our room cleaned during our stay. Called mgt. ca. 3:30 p.m. on 1st day to inquire why not. Their response: "Our housekeeping staff work until 5:00 p.m." When we returned later that evening, it was still not cleaned. The AC was not cooling upon our arrival, it was promptly repaired. Also didn't have an overhead vanity light functioning; it was also promptly repaired or so we thought. The next morning, it did not work again. The walkways had water all over from draining upstairs AC units. The pool was not very clean appearing nor was the entire motel. The staff and concierge were helpful. Usual Quality Inn breakfast. For our money though, it would be best if you stayed closer to downtown Key West to avoid traffic and parking hassles/expense from staying in this 'eastern' Key West locale. It will be more expensive than this Quality Inn, but worth it, in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good deal for Key West”
Reviews.Author: jaymedee0208
Reviews.Content: It is as soon as you get on the island- so you are about 2 miles away from the entertainment, but you really cant complain, not that long of a walk or bike ride - the island is only 3 miles. Staff was very nice, and the rooms were too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Gullix
Reviews.Content: Works great if you have a car since it is a 5 minute drive to the beach or downtown. But parking is easy in key west. 1,50$ per hour. Breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Nadia H
Reviews.Content: Clean, bright rooms, with complimentary breakfast, that had waffles ( my husband loves those), and fruits. The breakfast person was really nice and fast with restocking. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: anton w
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel, you can't beat the price. Great staff, delicious breakfast, little crowed in the morning, but there was plenty of everything. Will be back on our next visit to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “customer service”
Reviews.Author: l t
Reviews.Content: Stay & breakfast ok. Customer service very good. Dennis was really funny and welcome me like a person not just like a number who want a room and that make all the difference for me. So big thanks to Dennis and keep him for his naturel talent of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: James E
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days at this hotel. Enjoyed the laid back style. Rooms were very nice. Got to know my housekeeper, very polite and did a great job. Front desk girl seemed a little distracted, most of the time I saw her, but did her job. I will be back in the area in a few months, this will be on my short list for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it but is a long way to travel for an elderly couple.”
Reviews.Author: Gladys M B
Reviews.Content: The room was okay....was one of the older motels in the city and was one of the less expensive rooms available in Key West, where there are no cheap rooms anywhere. Could stand updating and remodeling. It had a refrigerator but no microwave and we were disappointed in that. The TV gave out but was quickly replaced by maintenance who was very pleasant and friendly. The staff was excellent and the breakfast was good, although not catered for folks who need to watch their diet or calorie intake. Waffles, pastries, boiled eggs, toast, cold cereal, coffee, juice, fruit, yogurt, lots of good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Key west family fishing trip”
Reviews.Author: sayyedastrip
Reviews.Content: Was a basic hotel nothing fancy. Nice cheap clean hotel to rest after fishing day and night. Had children with us ages 16months thru 12. When they weren't fishing they were playing in the complimentary pool. Had simple free breakfast eating area very small but people were nice so it wasn't problem. Staff was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Socal Flyer
Reviews.Content: Like the majority of Key West hotel/motels, the Quality Inn has a few years on it and the wear & tear shows in many small things. Overall, however, we found the facility adequate for a short stay and the price seemed average for the area. A friendly front desk clerk efficiently handled check-in formalities and our room was immediately available even though we were early. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, the plumbing worked. Although the motel fronts on a busy street, most of the rooms are far enough back to be isolated from traffic sounds. Our room had a TV, coffee maker (one of the irritating one-cup types) and an iron & ironing board. The hotel has a pool and serves a Continental-style breakfast, there is free wi-fi plus a single guest computer available in the lobby (no printer). In other words, pretty basic facility-wise. On the â€œconâ€� side we did experience a number of minor annoyances, although none were deal-breakers. There were wear & tear anomalies such as bed lights that appeared to be inoperative until we determined the faulty switch could be coaxed to work with deft pressure while turning, an air conditioner that would not operate at all on â€œhighâ€� blower setting and labored (not quite successfully in the afternoon) to keep the room tolerably cool, and wi-fi that repeatedly dropped out during use and presented login requests over and over. An environmental/design annoyance with our first-floor room was that water from constant air conditioning runoff at each room kept the narrow paved walkways fronting the rooms perpetually wet and dirty. The walkways were cleaned several times each day but immediately became muddy again and the result was that walking barefoot on our roomâ€™s carpet created â€œblack footâ€� syndrome from months of tracked-in dirt. Overall, we give this hotel a â€œadequateâ€� rating, no rave reviews but not a thumbs-down either.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this place.”
Reviews.Author: cissypissy
Reviews.Content: it is older and could use some updating, but they keep it clean, breakfast is good and plentiful and the rooms are a very nice size. staff is really friendly and helpful. the scooter rental place in the parking lot is a good place for scooters too.

Reviews.Title: “Room Ok- but outside property in desparate need of basic Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: PamP64
Reviews.Content: My sister booked 2 rooms for us under her name on Priceline Aug. 4 rooms 144 &146 last minute. The rooms were nice and the Queen beds were comfortable- updated . The front entry was being re-painted, but beyond that the rest of the outside was pitiful. I even asked a grounds maintenance guy why didn't they just get a truck load of mulch that the dirt was ugly and being tracked into the rooms. He said the mananger said they would be getting it for over 2 years. The pool deck is raised and the pavers are collapsing around the edges. The air condtioners were leaking all over the walkways-hazard. I was embarrased to stay there because it looks like a run down cheap no name motel on the outside. They advertise the Pool bars at the Lexington and Comfort Inn next door to them in their own rooms- which are much better and well kept Pools.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: pikappbh
Reviews.Content: This was originally a HoJos from the 60s with exterior hallways. As such its rooms are larger, the ceilings higher and neighbors seem noticeably quieter due to heavier construction than most built today . It is next to the ocean and is suffering surface blemishes. Some crumbling exterior concrete etc. My room was clean with none of the hap-hazard repairs weâ€™ve all seen in a budget motel. The staff were doing the best they could and were helpful and courteous. Beware any lower rated ones.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, too far from the Action”
Reviews.Author: d_rgPaducah_Kentucky
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and roomy, nice pool, good included breakfast. Just too far from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the first impression sway you”
Reviews.Author: Roswellcop
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the way down online as quiet frankly Quality Inn is the brand we have had the best luck with. We wanted to do the Best Western Ambassador for a the coupon rate of $109 but for some reason they were sold out (even though later we drove by and the parking lot was empty. Also they said they were on the beach and thats a lie) So we booked the Quality and as we pulled in I was a little disapointed as the outside is very dated. But checkin was easy quick and friendly. Lots of parking which is prime in the keys and once the room door was opened the inside was the same Quality Inn standards. Beds were clean and comfortable and a good size. The pool was clean and warm if again a little dated. The gardens around it were nice and secluded. The Comfort Inn next door's pool is in front of the Denny's. The only things I would complain about is the carpet of the room needs steam cleaning. My daughters feet were dirty after just a few minutes playing around the beds. And this was after we noticed and washed her feet thinking it was from the walk outside. Location wise its great nice northern side quiet and relaxing. The rooms need a refrigerator !!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here again...still a value.”
Reviews.Author: TheHatchet
Reviews.Content: Older motor lodge. If you want fancy, upscale, or something in the middle of the action, don't stay here. But for family value, this place can't be beat in Key West if you have access to a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: bdevegas
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel, which is expected with the low rates. Rooms were pretty clean, reception was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was much better than I thought. Everything was pretty much above my expectations for the price we were paying. Internet was a little on and off. The rooms were nicer than the neighboring hotel which had higher rates. This will probably be my spot when I go to the keys for just a cheap weekend getaway since I'm just north in miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience....would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: GoRedDevils
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great experience...the room (including the bathroom) was very clean. The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful. Concierge in lobby was most helpful with recommendations for dining and things to do. Concerns: Air conditioner struggled to keep up, but it was HOT in Key West. The vent in the bathroom was basically non-functional. Clean and affordable....everything that we were looking for!!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby and pool great- room not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: lbertch
Reviews.Content: Bathroom had mold, tub was dirty and beds/pillows not so comfortable. WiFi and refrig in room available. The lobby and pool area were very nice and no indication of what the rooms look like. Staff very friendly. Somewhat noisy also from other rooms and street.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: QuipQue
Reviews.Content: Key West is a very expensive place to stay and this hotel is not at all near all the action, but if you have a car and don't want to spend too much money, this is the place to be. The rooms are basic but clean. The staff at the front desk very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is free, which is nice, but do not expect too much. Breakfast staff also very friendly, they come by every table to ask if you need anything else before closing the breakfast area. There is a small but clean pool area in the middle of the property, with rooms all around the pool area. Expect at least a 15 minute drive (without traffic) to where all the action is. Hotel has free parking but watch out in the tourist area of KW to pay for parking or look for a garage because cops are everywhere and we saw a lot of cars with tickets. There is a Denny's in the hotel next door and other food options a little further. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “First time in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Homerright2
Reviews.Content: Great clean older motel. Nice helpful employees and the best breakfast I have ever had for "free". First time in the Key's so seeing a lot of country you wouldn't know was part of the US if you had only lived up north.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: JenLee01
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my sister-in-law to stay at for our wedding. We stayed with her the night before our wedding, as we didn't want to pay for a luxury hotel until we were married. We booked a room with two double beds. The beds and the breakfast area were the only decent aspects of this hotel. We weren't even allowed to plug in our electric car that we rented. I was the first one to use the faucet to wash my hands, and the knob came right off. Also, the bathroom had a horrid smell that was obvious upon walking in. Even after housekeeping had been there, the smell came back! I feel badly that I had my sister-in-law stay there. She was a good sport about it. Worst place ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Chloe2017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn for 2 nights and were rather pleased with what we got. OK, it is not a 5 star hotel but knowing the hotel prices in the keys (just check the rates in the motels along the road to key west!), we thought it was a good value! Our room was clean. We would have appreciate having a fridge though. Plenty of space to park in front of the room. The use of a crib for our little boy was free. Breakfast was really complete and there are tables to eat outside. There is a quiet, but rather large pool at the Quality Inn. We could also use the pool at the Comfort inn which is just a few steps away and has a tiki bar with music. There are many places to eat in the evening but they are mainly fast food or pizza places. We took the conch train tour in front of the hotel and booked a snorkeling tour directly at the hotel. Prices may be a little higher though... I would probably book a hotel in downtown Key West to experience the atmosphere at night if I was travelling with my husband only but for families, the Quality Inn is great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting unclean hotel, do not book it!!”
Reviews.Author: Florida081
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 days commencing 20/03/11 however on arrival to the hotel found the rooms very unclean:- rooms smelt and felt damp, hairs stuck to bed linen, bed linen did not feel clean, pillow cases dirty and damp patches on the beds. Refused to stay in the hotel. Guy at reception said he had stayed in worse!! Please do not waste your money and book this hotel, it will spoil your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased at The Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTwinsfan
Reviews.Content: When traveling we usually stay at Choice Hotels (Comfort Inn, Clarion, Quality Inn). In our opinion, this Quality Inn was a very good choice for our recent stay in Key West. It was conveniently located; as soon as we entered Key West on U.S. 1, we simply turned right on Roosevelt Boulevard and there it was on our left. The lobby was spacious and attractive, and led into the tropical courtyard with an outdoor swimming pool. Connected to the lobby was a good-sized breakfast area. The desk staff was welcoming, and the check-in process was prompt and efficient. There was also a concierge in the lobby to answer questions about Key West activities and assist with making reservations. Free daily newspapers were available. The guest rooms are accessed from the parking lot, and we easily found a place to park our car that was very close to our room. Although there was no elevator, we had no problem walking up the stairs to the second level where our room was located. Our standard room was spacious, attractive, clean, and smelled fresh. The room had all the standard amenities: cable tv, am/fm clock radio, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, coffee maker, room safe, soaps and shampoo. We appreciated being able to use our laptop computer with the free wireless high-speed internet. When we awoke in the morning, we recognized we were truly in Key West when we heard the crowing of a neighborhood rooster! The free breakfast included a nice variety of hot and cold items. The Old Town Trolley tour has a stop right next door, so we purchased tickets and enjoyed the 90-minute narrated tour of Key West. The trolley tour allowed us to hop on and off at several different stops so we could explore many parts of the town without having to drive and search for parking places. And at the end of the day, we rode the trolley right back to our hotel. Our check-out was quick and easy, and there were no complications with our bill. From the parking lot we pulled onto Roosevelt and turned left onto U.S. 1, heading out of Key West without fighting any traffic. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Pro's & Con's and Desk Clerk Said "NO HBO" When There Was HBO?”
Reviews.Author: raterMurrellsInlet
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold Choice Member who has stayed in many Choice Hotels. Pro's = Better than average breakfast with large, hot sausage patties to go with hard boiled eggs. You could make sausage and egg sandwiches. Low rates for Key West, especially if you book well in advance online directly through Choice Hotels and are AAA or Senior. Priceline has the lowest prices if booked well in advance. Good size rooms with two queens available, and there are about 6 mini-fridges that the director of operations, Sharon, for the "same owner Comfort Inn" next door and the Quality Inn says can moved to your room, if you request it early and one is available upon arrival. There is a Publix relatively close by for food/snacks. If you have your car or rent a car, the drive to Duval Street and harbor areas is only about 15 min., depending upon traffic. There was almost instant very hot water and plenty of it, and they did clean our room early as we requested every day. The bottom line is that I would stay there again now that I know what to expect, as long as I got a good price ($108 to $135 for early Feb.). Con's = No elavators to the second floor, so a lot of heavy luggage could be a pain carrying up those outside stairs. We had only one soap, so had to get another for the shower. Hotel claims that the poolside rooms are more desireable, and have a greater chance of having a mini-fridge in them, so they charge a bit more for them. I thought they would be more noisy, and some are on the way to the public bathrooms. Doors slamming shut close by are easily heard, but that can happen at most motels. The one desk clerk from Poland told me that there was "No HBO" when I complained about the static in the muffled sound that accompanied a decent ("analog" it said) Comcast picture. I checked another room and found the Comcast problem was in all the rooms. Sharon (Operations Mgr.) said that clerk should not have told me there was no HBO. That same desk clerk refused to move a second "foldable luggage stand" into our room when we requested it. No microwaves in the rooms, but one is in the front breakfast area (across from the front desk) available for anyone to use at any time. The bathrooms are small with no non-slip surfaces or rubber mats for the tub floor when taking a shower. As far as cleanliness is concerned, It is average, and I've seen worse, but the entire facility is old and most things have been "patched", like bathtub sealant, rather than completely remodeled inside. I wear bedroom slippers in all hotel rooms, as I believe non of them are disenfected properly every day. New carpeting and paint would make a nice difference along with newer TV's, and remodeled bathrooms/ vanity areas.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting bathroom”
Reviews.Author: netmorby110
Reviews.Content: Got a real deal - only $107 per night for a room with two queens. It was a discount special for either AAA or because we're seniors. That's very reasonable for Key West. For a little more, we could've gotten a King room by the pool - but we figured it might be noisy by the pool. When we got to the hotel, the front didn't look quite as updated as the photography would suggest. But, we were okay with economy. Then when we got inside, we found out that the internet service was only in the lobby. Disappointing, but perhaps I didn't read the amenities correctly. Not a deal-breaker. We checked in, went to our room and were appalled. First, the drive to the room from the lobby was through a dark parking lot with uneven terrain or pehaps even pot holes. The room itself was adjacent to a laundry area with a bunch of large bins standing by and a huge laundry truck sitting in the closest parking space. The room was supposed to be nonsmoking but it had a stale air. I immediately checked out the bathroom and was appalled. The plastic tub/shower stall was broken in several places, and when I ran my hand over one of the cracks, I got a sticky dirty substance on my hand. Then I noticed the hairs stuck to the sticky stuff. We went back to the front and asked for another room. The desk clerk told us that there were no rooms left. That's possible but we suspect that there were just no cheap rooms left. Given the circumstances, she should have given us an upgrade if possible. She was unfriendly but ultimately agreed to refund our first-night's payment and cancel the reservation. My husband asked her to wait while we ascertained that there were other rooms nearby. As he put it, "a dirty room is better than sleeping in the car." We saw that there was a Marriott Resort across the street, so we called Marriott. They had vacancies at that Marriott resort - which was oceanfront - as well as at Marriott Courtyard and at the Fairfield Inn, all within a couple of miles. There was no pressure to choose any of them - we were free to check them out and then plunk down our money. Having established that, we went back to the front desk and had the reservation cancelled and refunded. Or so we thought. 5 days later, the charge was still on our account. Our overall impression is that the "Quality Inn" is No-Quality.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bob1340
Reviews.Content: My feeling is that if you are reading these reveiws then you should know what to expect when you arrive. Don't complain about what others have already told you. After my reading the reveiws I found this place much better than I expected. I got more than my moneys worth. I would reccommend this place to anyone who knows how to read a map. If you travel only so you can complain then please stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelkat47
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 years in a row. It's a little worn around the edges but very clean and quiet. The staff is always helpful and friendly, and you can't beat the value !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean but a LONG way from the action on Duval St”
Reviews.Author: ryanpiller
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and were looking for a budget option in this overpriced town. Easy to find as it's just as you enter Key West, at the northern end of the island. The hotel looks a bit old fashioned (like an old motor court hotel) but the room was comfortable enough, very clean, shower was hot and there was plenty of space for our gear. Check in was friendly and there is even a concierge to give you some tips, free drinks passes and assist with taxis etc. Breakfast was good, with my favourite - cook your own waffles. We knew that the hotel was out of the Old Town but it is a long way out. A $16 taxi ride to Duval St as public transport is virtually non existent. You need to factor at least $35 for the return taxi trip so in hindsight, we would have been better staying closer to the Old Town, paying a bit more for our hotel and walking. Still, the parking is free at the Quality Inn and I couldn't see anywhere in the Old Town where the parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: OldManWanderer
Reviews.Content: Was in Key West to check on home of friend & air conditioning was not working. Spent first night at Days Inn next door & bed was terrible. They used some type of foam rubber blanket. Second night we moved to the Comfort Inn for less money (Senior Rate) and it was near perfect. Poolside room with twin queens with small fridge & microwave. Each bed had 4 nice feather pillows and a quilted comforter that you usually only see in upscale hotels. To top it all off they had a nice breakfast bar in the morning. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean!”
Reviews.Author: cindycinn
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It was SUPER clean and fresh smelling (inside the room) and with the upgrades done in our room, it was much more than I expected based upon it's rankings and reviews on this site. The beds are Sleep Number beds. There are separate AC units for the L/R and Bedroom in the suites. If you ask, bottles of water at the front desk are FREE. The breakfast was a really nice treat too. The pool is clean and large with ample seating. Parking is free. There is a 24 hour Denny's connected to the hotel, too. I was in Key West searching for lodging options for my wedding, to be held there in Feb 2011. I will place this hotel as a budget option for my guests. Beware, though you will need a car. Duval Street is NOT within walking distance from this area of the island. The drive there is less than 10 mins though. Enjoy and I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice in key west. I booked...”
Reviews.Author: miamitonian
Reviews.Content: Not my first choice in key west. I booked my trip at the last minute for a couples weekend trip. Everything was booked, so we stay at the comfort inn. The price we paid wasn't that cheap. The have a large pool with a bar. The staff was helpful, even after we made like 100 different requests. Breakfast is included, which is a plus. Its continental food: boiled eggs, two types of cereal, american coffee, pastries, toast. The rooms are small. We had four adults and a baby. We almost couldn't fit the crib. Overall, the hotel is in need of a major update, but its okay if you're first and second choice hotels are not available.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Wonderful bed. Good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: JoanieSarasota
Reviews.Content: It costs a fortune to stay downtown, and with breakfast included this place was just fine. I'm surprised to see people say the place wasn't clean, our room was perfect. Nice duvets, the mattress was fabulous. Bathroom is spacious and clean. Breakfast is more than adequate for a motel freebie and the staff were continually taking care to make sure that everything was clean, fresh and plentiful. For a Comfort Inn I have no complaints whatsoever. If what you want is the Waldorf Astoria then i suggest you go stay at the Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for expensive Key West”
Reviews.Author: Koko-oz
Reviews.Content: Anywhere else this property would be considered grossly overpriced but in Key West it was probably reasonable value for money and when you are on a budget, you can't be too choosy. Having said that, the rooms were large and clean, the beds very comfortable and the pool area inviting. The Inn is currently upgrading to a Quality Inn so had a better breakfast than expected for a continental - good value considering it was included in the price. The only problem was that the breakfast area is tiny and there are not enough tables making it a real struggle to comfortably serve yourself and then sit and eat. Another problem was a permanent puddle at the bottom of the stairs between building 1 & 2 which came from a constant water overflow which meant the bottom stairs were always wet and you got dripped on every time you went up and down. As it had been raining just before we arrived we didn't think much of this at the start, but when the problem continued on unabated into the second day without any more rain, it got annoying. Also the wifi internet is non-existent. Their provider does not seem to be compatible with any modern laptops/netbooks and operating systems and after many calls to the front desk to try and get connection working, we just gave up. I ended up using the computers in the lobby downstairs to complete the essential stuff. We found this same problem at another Quality/Comfort Inn - they need to look into it. We did not find the front desk service overwhelmingly helpful and friendly either - not by comparison with many other places - but we did note that the hotel has a lot of tour buses staying so that could explain the lacklustre attitude. The location is on the main road when you first come onto Key West so it is quite a long way to all the sights and happenings in the old town but as long as you have a car, it is only a few minutes drive. Also, we noticed the tourist trolley stopped just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “This Comfort Inn is switching to Quality Inn and not a moment too soon”
Reviews.Author: ngtybtnice
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is listed as a Comfort Inn, the marquis outside says â€œsoon to be a Quality Innâ€� and in our opinion, thatâ€™s not a moment too soon. In fact, if there was category lower than Quality Inn, thatâ€™s where this place should be ranked. Itâ€™s terrible!! The list of things wrong with it are many: The rate was over-priced for what we got The attitude of the front desk â€“ rude and unhelpful For their â€œfree internet accessâ€� they use something called Ethostream. We have a newer laptop (Dell with Windows XP) and use it without any problem at every other hotelâ€¦. except for this place. Three calls to Ethostreamâ€™s â€œcustomer serviceâ€� told us that the problem was on the hotelâ€™s end and that a techniciain would have to come out and fix it. The front desk denied the problem was theirs and tried to convince us that the problem was â€œour computerâ€�â€¦ which is was not. We ended up with no internet access while we stayed there. Once we left, our computer worked fine and we have not had a problem since then. The towel rack in our room was broken and considering the â€œassistance" we received from the front desk staff, itâ€™s not worth reporting. The shower drain and faucets leaked and there was mildew stains The carpet was stained the threadworn The interior of the hotel is shabby The nicest person was the young man who worked restocking the MEAGER breakfast buffet. He worked very hard and had a smile for everyone. Choice Hotels (the parent company) should make him the hotel manager and fire the staff they had there. We would never go back there and we would certainly not recommned this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, in process of changing to Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: snapngo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the eastern end of Key West so you'll need a car to get to the marina, restaurants and shops. They had a nice gentleman at a desk in the lobby who pointed out places of interest in Key West and gave me a map and pointers on how to get around. The rooms are clean and the service was very nice. Wireless internet was too weak in the room, but it's fine in the lobby and they have a PC available for use. They let you print out your airline boarding pass at no charge. We didn't get to eat at the breakfast as it starts at 7 am and we had to leave before that - I'd like all hotels to start breakfast a 6 am. Coffee was available at all times in the lobby. They do have a safe in the room that you're required to pay $1 a day for. It's a nice feature. The room was clean and comfortable. They are changing this from a Comfort Inn to a Quality Inn - the front desk had a Quality Inn sign on the wall - so I'm guessing it's going to go through some remodeling. You might want to call and ask about that. Parking at the hotel is free, but be warned that parking is hard to find in downtown Key West. If you're going for an all-day boat ride, park in the big covered garage on Caroline Street for $13/day.

Reviews.Title: “How it is a Comfort Inn I dont know”
Reviews.Author: Traveler6810
Reviews.Content: First of all it is an outdoor property, how is is Comfort inn, never have to to a Comfort inn that is an outdoor hotel. As soon as i entered, it says quality inn in the background. They gave me a room and i went into the room they wrote on the key for me. To my amazement someone else was inside of my room. Went back and they gave me the right key for the right room. The lady was in a rush to go home she screwed up. Went into my room, no room directory, looks like they just cleaned up and gave me the room without checking it. I then asked the housekeepers to give me more towels and grabbed a room directory. The pen said comfort inn and the pad said Quality inn????? Then i went to the pool, it was okay. How it is a comfort inn i don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Horror Hotel - Bedbugs and the poorest customer service ever.”
Reviews.Author: 19MJ74
Reviews.Content: Where to start? check-in: a blond girl who didn't even try to speak proper English with us as soon she had seen our polish passports. She went like: C.A.R ????? (showing movements of the steering wheel with her hands) Yes, we did have a car and we can speak English, most probably better than she ever will. No need to treat us like idiots. At night we got bitten by several bedbugs and the pillow sheet was covered in blood ( of which we have photographs and video) We went down to the receptionist ( his name was RAD) who was not able to find another room for us as, (as he said) the hotel and entire Keys were booked out. He agreed to book a room in MIAMI. He of course didn't book anything for us but promised that the hotel will pay the bill next morning and we only need to provide our room number in the Comfort Suites in Miami. He refused to give me the manager on the phone even though he was speaking with her in my appearance. So at 00:45am we went to Miami. After 3 hours drive we finally managed to check in and got some sleep. Before that, the receptionist provided Rad with our room number as requested and went to bed. After a great night and breakfast we had In Comfort Suites Kendall in Miami we went to reception in order to check out. Guess what? The bill was not paid, no one even try to reach us in the hotel. So we called the manager (Sharon) - she did know about the bedbug problem and about the fact that the receptionist sent us to Miami middle in the night. Also she knew that he agreed with us to pay the bill. BUT - as she stated, her receptionist was NOT IN POSITION to agree such things with us. Dear Sharon - why should we care, who is, and who is not in position to agree such things or not? He represented your hotel to us. What he is in position to is not our business. And as I asked Sharon what is she going to do about the problem, she said: "Well. I didn't charge you for the night" Thank you, that you didn't charge us for the night we spend in our car driving to Miami all covered in bedbugs bites. That is what I call fantastic customer service. :/ However, Sharon refused to pay the bill, and I requested her Manager Mr. Steve Robins to call me back. Of course, Mr Robins just happened to be in a meeting, so Sharon, who actually called me back. Now as it seems, Mr Robins agreed to pay the bill when we send the folio to Sharon per fax. So we did. After 3 days no check received and we are still in Miami. But you know what is the worst thing? During that whole horror experience we didn't hear A SINGLE WORD of apologizing. Not even a simple "We're sorry" That is just cheap and poor. We will never stay there again. Oh, and don't get fooled by the "free Internet access" - there in no such thing.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh - don't do it! Find a smaller, private inn somewhere else on the island”
Reviews.Author: FoodiefromOH
Reviews.Content: When you first drive into Key West, Comfort Inn (along with a couple other chains) is right there, so it seems like it would be an easy option. Ugh, it is soooo not. Part of the problem is simply the prices in Key West; where I would have expected to pay at or under $100 for this place, the daily rate was well above $200. If you have an Entertainment Book, use it. That was the only way we could make it affordable. The room was clean enough, the bathroom was not clean at all, I hated taking a shower in there, the bathtub was dingy and had mold stains. The sink/vanity area, which contained a coffeepot and basic coffee supplies, was overrun with tiny little ants. It is not easy access to anything on the island, you will definitely have to drive or take a taxi. We tried to rent bicycles through the group set up in the parking lot, but after waiting an hour, we decided to try our luck on Duval Street - glad we did, it was half the price and no deposit (the place at the hotel wanted a $50 deposit per bike). Worst part of the trip by far though was the second morning, when the wooden headboard fell off and smacked me across the face. I called down and asked for maintenance, they were very prompt. But when I complained about this to the hotel manager, all she would say is they could move me to another room if I felt unsafe but they would not compensate me in any other way. No apology, no checking to see if I was hurt and needed help. To me, that is really bad service. Continental breakfast was basic/fine, but the room fills up way too quickly and it is overcrowded. I checked into some of the smaller, private inns along and off Duval St when I was walking there, and I would strongly recommend them over this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: fishinjim65
Reviews.Content: I used some of my reward points from Choice Hotels for 2 free nights. It wasn't worth it. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. Old run down hotel. Smart aleck desk clerk (Peter). I think they thought I was getting a free room, so I should just put up with it. They gave us a dumpy room and told us everything else was booked. That wasn't true.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vern30341
Reviews.Content: The website states that the motel has free, high-speed internet access in all rooms. This is not true. The front desk clerk told me that they were getting access, but did not have it when I checked in. The hotel is very worn and you have to take a cab to do anything on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Better than Expected.”
Reviews.Author: TheHatchet
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive booking this hotel considering some of the reviews, but we had no trouble whatsoever. The place is older, yes, and if you are someone who prefers the best in life, then this place isn't for you. But for a family on a budget, this hotel is great. The pool was very nice, the free breakfast was right on the spot (make-your-own waffles, cereals, pastries, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, coffee, etc - but the breakfast nook gets very crowded), the service was outstanding for a hotel in this price range, and the concierge was able to save us a lot of money. She is obviously paid to steer you toward certain activities and businesses, but once she understood that we knew what we wanted, she was very good at helping with discounts. It is not within walking distance of anything you go to Key West to do, but we had a rental car so location was not a problem. It was a relatively quiet area, and there were a few shops & restaurants nearby. The staff was eager to help and all were very friendly. Overall it was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “bug bites”
Reviews.Author: Floridaeye
Reviews.Content: Periodically we drive down to Key West for a day or two. I understand the saying, you get what you pay for but I did not expect for my daughter and I to get lots of bug bites. They were on my neck, hands and upper arm. The sheets were white but had a few areas of other peopleâ€™s hair, and the comforter had 3 suspicious red spots. I realize now, one I notice that I should have asked for a different room. I think it was either flea or bed bugs bites.

Reviews.Title: “good budget option for Key West”
Reviews.Author: Casualist
Reviews.Content: Hotels don't come cheap in Key West, so I was under no illusions when booking this one that I wasn't going to get a historic wooden hotel on Duvall Street. The set-up is typical Comfort Inn, very dated 1980's motel style rooms, but the air-con worked and the rooms were quiet enough. The pool area never got busy and it was even possible to swim laps, while admiring the iguanas in the trees. Reception desk were very helpful with regards to organising tours (we booked a boat trip to see the reef). The location is on the edge of town, next to the main highway, hardly romantic, but there are moke and bicycle hire places next door. Actually Key West is such a charming town, one of the few in the USA which could be considered as pretty, so it almost seems a travesty staying in a motel on the edge of town, but if budget dictates then so be it. The centre is about 10 minutes drive by car. There is a good Checkers burger joint a few minutes drive up the road into town, but the free breakfast is good enough, even if the dining area is hopelessly small. Of course like all motels the food is served on plastic plates with plastic cutlery, but it fills a hole. Soft drink vending machines on site. No chance of buying alcohol here. Free wireless internet was working when I was there. A good budget option but if you've travelled all the way here, you deserve a better location in Key West. Dining tip: great Hard Rock Cafe in town.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel for basic price”
Reviews.Author: diverdude2
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that has had a minimal facelift. We had a double room for $99 a night, which is pretty much a bargain in KW. We were there to scuba dive so we weren't planning on staying in the room much. The front desk clerk at check in was very personable and efficient. One particular consierge was extremely pushy. To the point that it offended me enough to walk away. The free breakfast is poorly laid out and the dining area is too small. It always seemed crowded, although it was well stocked and an attendant was always present. We had the shocking experience of watching a hotel maintenance worker dip his dirty hands into the ice machine to get ice to use to wash the dirt from his hands. I called the hotel to confirm that they had wireless internet in the rooms and was assured that they did. Every evening the internet service ground to a halt, probably from not having a solid infrastructure. When my son went to the desk to inquire if they were having problems, the desk clerk told him that rooms do not have internet, only the lobby. This was in spite of using it in the room and having an instruction card on how to log on sitting on the desk in the room. This is not a great hotel but it covers the basics for a lot less than most KW hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: pam_rhea_2000
Reviews.Content: I know there are a few bad reviews, but this hotel was a nice place to stay. It was not a resort, so if that is what you are looking for, don't stay here. We wanted a place to stay that would not break the bank and still be able to enjoy Key West. Because it is older, the rooms are very large. The bathroom left a little to be desired, but since all we used it for was to take a shower it was fine. Our room was clean and the staff vaccumed it each day. We loved being able to catch the trolley right next door. This is a great way to see Key West and decide what places require more time. We were able to catch a taxi back to the room each evening. It is not near a beach, but because Key West is not that big, it did not take long to get to either beach on the Atlantic side. If you don't want to spend all of your money on a room and are planning on spending most of your time exploring the island, this is a great place to stay. They staff was very helpful and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and shower for a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Palescrawnyguy
Reviews.Content: The place is obviously one of the cheapest options around. It's exactly what you'd expect. The only complaint I'd make is that the shower water temperauture flucuates 10x more than anywhere else I'd ever been. You get one second of too hot water (not scscalding though) then one second of good temp then one second of cold water then all over again. Very strange. Again, definitely a value hotel. Their complimentAry breakfast was better than expected. Multiple juices and two waffle machines among a couple other things. No wireless in rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: kll0428
Reviews.Content: We saw the mixed reviews on Trip advisor and when we were looking for a place to stay this was the least expensive at $200+ a night. At any price this hotel isn't worth it. The rooms are bare minimum. There were bugs in our room and when we called the front desk they sent a guy to look at the situtation he sprayed something but it didn't get rid of the bugs. The island was booked so we had no choice but to stay. The lamp shades were rusted and old, the sheets smelled musty and the neighbors toliet flushed ours but when we tried to flush it, it wouldn't flush. The only good thing is the front desk people were nice and parking was free. Stay somewhere else. This hotel is really dated and it is pretty clear the owners just take in the money and do bare minimum on upkeep of the place. It isn't even close to Duvel Street. Really ... stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT Waste your Money on this old, leaky and foul smelling hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sample08
Reviews.Content: This was one of the crappiest hotel i ever stayed . I paid almost $111 for a night with choked toilet , choked tub, water leaking out of walls and broken AC. I would never ever recommend anyone to waste money on this hotel. its worth to spend 50 or 60 dollars more and choose a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chumpsky909
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious, clean and tidy. The hotel building itself is looking very tired, but the room was fine. Definitely good value.

Reviews.Title: “poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: y2kman
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel knowing the reputation of the brand. Paid $125 for a double bed room...rooms were ok and despite our request, we were given room in the second floor with a tractor trailer parked out side...morning breakfast was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Super Staff Why pay more?”
Reviews.Author: yeah009
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is excellent, staff are helpful, the rooms are clean. This hotel is also one of the cheapest ones I have visited. (Don,t let that put you off in any way) The complementary breakfast is the icing on the cake (so to speak) Only complaint is the location is not brilliant but that,s OK Going to Key West? Why pay more?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well-provided for motel”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurIntrepide
Reviews.Content: We had very comfortable 3 days here at an excellent price. The breakfast was very good, tho' a little crowded in the morning - it was so popular. The consierge in the foyer was extrememly helpful, as were the staff. The surroundings were well-planted and we enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn--Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Angelique0721
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Comfort Inn in Key West, and overall were happy with our choice. We had picked this hotel online, being one of the 2 cheaper options in Key West. The reason for the price, I'm sure, is the location. Granted Key West is not a big island, however walking from the hotel to the downtown Duvall Street area was just not an option. And while we had driven here, the parking downtown wasn't great either. But we managed, so it is feasible. The continental breakfast was pretty decent (waffle bar, the standard variety of danishes, etc). And while our room was right across from the pool, we (surprisingly) weren't bothered by the noise. The service from everyone we dealt with was great. Really no complaints except for the location. So as long as you're up for an adventure with the driving and parking downtown, I'd recommend giving the Comfort Inn a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Key West”
Reviews.Author: CinziaOrchard
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn in Key West was a pleasant surprise. We didn't think we would be able to afford to stay in Key West, but found the Comfort Inn to be a good value. My husband and kids loved the ample pool, the rooms were good, the breakfast was good. If we returned to Key West, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little extra and stay next door at the Radisson”
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen its days. All and all, I would charge no more than $99.00 a night any time of the year period to stay here. I was charged $150.00 a night and stayed for just one night and left early because of the quality. I guess I was expecting something nicer like the hotel right next door to them that was a little bit more but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied With This Stay”
Reviews.Author: landrunner
Reviews.Content: My son (25) and I (65) arrived 3/23 and stayed 4 nights. I found all to be as expected after spending many, many hours researching where to stay in Key West. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable, everything worked as advertised, and, having read other reviews, I was happy to find that all the positive revues were accurate, and none of the negative reviews came to pass. The pool was very nice (wish there had been a hot tub), clean and well maintained. The breakfast was as expected. I found there was plenty of room and opportunity to serve oneself unless you were there about 8:00 to 8:15, when there was a little bit of a crowd. By the way, the Inn appeared full, or close to it, each night we were there. The staff kept all the stuff stocked, coffee, milk, breakfast food, rolls, waffle mix, juices, eggs, etc. until 10:00. Everything was kept clean and neat. The location was fine for us. We drove where required and encountered very minor parking problems. I expect over 5 days we had to pay about 35 to 40 dollars in parking fees on perhaps 6 or 8 occasions. For the most part, on street or free parking was available within a block of our destinations. The Inn is very handy to the only good beach in the area, Smathers, maybe a 3 minute drive, 6 to 8 minutes by bike. It is also handy to Stock Island where our preferred Seafood Spot, the Shrimp Shack, was located. To get to the piers on the West end of Duval, where we did our fishing, was a 5-8 minute drive. I really have no reservations about the location if you have a car, or are willing to call a cab, or ride a bike or small motorcycle. If your thing is partying hardy on Duval, this is probably not your spot. The clientele was adults and families. Didn't see any spring breakers there.. Also, recommend the Kyushu Japanese Restaurant for Sushi lovers. We didn't have a bad dining experience, which surprised me considering all the negative reviews about. We did spend most of our first day there talking to locals who didn't appear to have a stake in it about things to do and places to eat. In my opinion it was time well spent and we weren't steered wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Typical "old" motel”
Reviews.Author: SCVoyageur
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute for one night & got a good rate. We were on the second floor & didn't have any ants or bugs as reported in earlier reviews. The carpet was clean & beds comfortable. The bathroom needs work as the bath tub area is rusted and has been recaulked too many times, The sink area could have been cleaner. We liked the location as we rented bikes reasonably at the entrance to the hotel & set off to the beaches & to tour KW all day. It's easy on and easy off the island from here. Breakfast was typical CI. The exterior is shabby & needs refurbishment but it's KW!!

Reviews.Title: “Think before - booking”
Reviews.Author: koh2
Reviews.Content: BEWARE!!!!! When my husband and I arrived the man checking us in made many goof ups. First he checked us in under another persons reservation which was only for 2 days and we were staying for 4. We realized this after he took our credit card. Then he told us the cost of the 4 nights and it was going to be over $250 more. He argued about it so I called the 1800 number on my own cell phone. He did not offer the hotels phone:( Once the lady on the phone gave him the rates for 3 nights he appeared annoyed and hung up the phone not waiting for the 4th night rate. He still wanted to charge us more for the 4th night. The conceirge was wonderful giving us coupons and directions. He spoke to us whenever we saw him. Once we arrived back to our room there were BUGS all over the room. The head custodian did spray our room within minutes. Once we returned from our leave due to the BUGS our room keys would not work!! I was scared to walk on the floor barefoot. But at 5am in the morning we were woken up by the garbage collectors taking the garbage out of the dumpsters. WHAT NOISE!!! To make it even better we had a handicapped room and didn't want or need it. There was not a real bath tub or shower. The wall paper in the bathroom was falling down and it really smelled like mildew.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than here”
Reviews.Author: MVHS1S
Reviews.Content: This place needs updating and cleaning. The rooms have microscopic bugs (ants?) all over. Free wireless internet was not working at all during the stay, we were told they were switching internet providers. Pillows need replacing, no fan in bathroom. A/C unit died out during the night so we had no air flow what so ever in the room. Rest of the room is basic, nothing fancy. Hotel pool looked old, needs updating also. The free continental breakfast was not bad, typical fare but nice to have. Computer in lobby did work so at least was able to do quick email checks since we did not have the free wireless. Next visit to Key West will stay somewhere else and somewhere closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “don't do it! pay $10 more for a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: flautissimo
Reviews.Content: My fellow photographer and I are in Key West to shoot a wedding and we made the mistake of staying at the Comfort Inn. The rooms were booked for us via priceline for $140 per night, and as soon as we checked in I knew we were in for a less than ideal visit. The bathroom is horrible; the bath spout drips and its drain was backed up. There's a huge crack in the bathtub plastic and no ventilation system for the toilet/shower area. The carpets are dirty, the table is sticky, and there are stains on the curtains. The lock on the door jiggles. The room stinks. The keys are constantly discharging their ability to unlock our room. The wireless internet wasn't working our first night here. The bedside light's cord is taped together with black electrician's tape. The remote control is holding batteries in with more of this electrician's tape. The worst part is the microscopic ants all over the room and counters. We expect some critters in this environment, but these suckers are EVERYWHERE. And no wonder with all of the delicious buildup of sticky, dirty, and greasy particles on every surface! On the plus side, there is free wireless, and an in room safe that actually works. The "big free breakfast" isn't that great but it's better than nothing. I'm still stunned that someone is paying $140 per night for us to be here. Save yourself lots of headaches and spend an extra $10-20 per night and get one of the better hotels. There are lots of other options here in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: irishladdie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn in Keywest for 4 nights, the staff was very helpful and always ready to answer any questions. The room was clean and the breakfast was as most Comfort Inn and Sleep Inn breakfast which is enough food for me. If you expect a Ritz Hilton, then you would not want to book a room, but for us Economy Vacationers it was a nice place. The pool is large, clean and warm, there is a nice Pool Bar next door, the Visitors Center is on the other side of the Hotel and I really enjoyed my stay. Irishladdie

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smallcatoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very basic but nice. The staff was excellent and helpful. A scooter and bike rental place is next door and you can easily rent a bike although the hours of the place are limted during the off season. If you are going to Duvall area you will need to drive or rent a vehicle to get there. I would consider the hotel just below Comfort Inn standards and is more like a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and its a shame they are closing :(”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Key West all my life and decided to stay at the Comfort Inn with my father who was visiting, so i stayed here. The hotel I know its old (built in 1970), but its very well built and they've renovated it many times. The rooms are really comfortable with nice beds and a clean bathroom. The free breakfast was great with waffles and good coffee. The pool is real old because its 8 feet deep (not many pools are that deep these days). But I think its fine. The worse thing thats going to happen is at the end of July 2008 is that they are due for demolition to this hotel and the other 3 hotels nearby (Days Inn, Holiday Inn, and Radisson), to make a 450 room hotel with a convention center at the entrance of Key West. To me its just ridiculous to do that because all 4 hotels are really well built and are renovated. But anyway if you come to Key West before the end of July you should definitely stay here before they close down.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for a bait and swith on the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Darnel0813
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a group of 4, we booked two non smoking rooms for two nights from 4/5-4/7, through hotels.com. The front desk clerk proceeded to tell us that we had booked smoking rooms, instead of non smoking rooms. We knew this was incorrect as each of us is highly allergic to smoke and plus we had our written confirmation from hotels.com showing the reservation was for non smoking rooms. He then tried to tell us that they charge extra for non smoking rooms, which we had already prepaid through hotels.com. He was very rude and only after threatening to get hotels.com on the phone and with the help of another front desk clerk did we get the rooms we reserved. Once we arrived at our rooms upstairs, they are a little less than average. One of the rooms had a dirty bedspread with brown stuff on it, yuck! Both rooms smelled of mold and mildew. The property definitely needs some updating and is a solid 1-2 star hotel. Otherwise the housekeeping staff was very friendly and helpful, the other front desk agents were great with the exception of the guy we had at check in. I would suggest shopping around. You can get more for your money and a lot closer to the action and hopefully not the bait and switch.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best lodging option in Key West”
Reviews.Author: trickangle
Reviews.Content: Like most Comfort Inns I've stayed at, my experience at the Key West location was average. On the upside, the room was clean and spacious, and the continental breakfast was above average. On the downside, the Internet did not work (and the front desk person did not speak good enough English to help), there was no elevator for second floor rooms, and the location is poor. If I were to stay in Key West again, I would pay more to stay closer to the heart of the city and also to get better quality. The Comfort Inn was no more memorable than numerous other chain hotels, but it was a decent room for a decent price. I would give it 2 1/2 stars if half stars were an option. I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: verybuckeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for a long weekend. We were pleased with the accommodations. It is not a luxury hotel by any means, but it was clean and comfortable. The pool is beautiful, and the breakfast was above average for a free continental breakfast. Location was fine. We had a rental car, and had no difficulty getting anywhere on the island. I would definitely stay here again, especially for the price - we paid at least $80 less than most of the other choices, and were definitely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “nice place just a little dated”
Reviews.Author: rickandjudie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at comfort inn key west on points as well. I do not understand what previous people are complaining about. The hotel was very clean and the staff were more than helpfull. The room was pool view 1st floor. It was large clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were just fine. The free breakfast was also quite enjoyable. The hotel is old but non stop staff washing and cleaning everywhere more than made up for the age. We would get up early each day and have breakfast drive to old key west park and walk and shop and stop for drinks. Me turning 50 years old even went parasailing which we booked through the concierge at the hotel,. They have a computer in the lobby and internet as well no charge You can also go next door to the radisson hotel to use their pool if you like. We mainly used our pool at the comfort inn. Everything was great - You can not beat key west and this hotel even if we were paying we would stay. Some people just too picky i guess. They also have chickens and roosters walking around this just adds to the charm of the hotel and location. I hope you enjoy your trip

Reviews.Title: “OK, But More Like An Econolodge”
Reviews.Author: rocknrun
Reviews.Content: I used my frequent stay points with Choice Hotels so I didn't pay any cash for the room. This is the only Choice Hotel property at Key West, and it was OK, but if I was paying I'd stay elsewhere. The beds and pillows weren't very comfortable and the property is dated. Location is OK, close to the beaches. Value for the points paid was terrible, 20,000 points per night. I've stayed ocean front in a very nice suite in Virginia Beach for that amount, but they have no competition in KW for Choice point stays. Staff was nice and there was a concierge in the lobby which was convenient for booking a tour. Wireless internet was at times slow, and signal varied. Next trip to Key West I'll probably stay elsewhere though.

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime”
Reviews.Author: schnep
Reviews.Content: I laughed when we pulled into the parking lot, as their marquee sign said "stay here, make your own waffles" -- what kind of a selling point is that? But we'd already paid for the room, so we didn't have a choice. The lobby is fine, and the staff fairly nice, but the room was dirty and outdated. The bathroom was particularly offensive, with grungy tile, and a floor that wasn't thoroughly cleaned. Water pressure was terrible. Bedspreads were frightening. There is a free continental breakfast, but the coffee is terrible. I would suggest staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the Madness and very nice”
Reviews.Author: ezsurfer
Reviews.Content: Very clean. The Comfort Inn is getting a little old, but the warmth of the staff certainly made up for any issues I saw. Excellent touches, the pool area was immaculate, the breakfast nook was superb. Easily a $10 pp breakfast on this island. Waffles, coffee, bagels danish, cereal. 4 toasters. little to no wait. Fresh coffee, juice, literally a very nice meal for all types of appetites. The paper at the door every morning was an extra unexpected touch. Everything in the room worked, no issues with leaks, bugs, or any unsightly or inconveniently broken items. the parking seemed a bit crowded, but there was plenty. We parked easily in the front in a very well lit area for our stay. Only reason I wouldn't give it an Excellent rating is just plain age and location. Although not an issue if you know Key West OR can ride a bicycle, the Comfort Inn is located away from the craziness of Duval Street. We picked it for just that reason, and the stay there was rewarding. The bicycle vendor in their parking lot was excellent, accomodating, and had reasonable charges.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Manager Tricks and Bait and Switch on Reservations”
Reviews.Author: lookingforfairshake
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting a 5 Star Hotel as its just a Comfort Inn. As we checked in we were Greeted by Nice Friendly Staff. CON 1 They wanted to upcharge our room from our booking. The Clerk said only our FIRST night was at the Booked Rate.The Clerk was nice thru-out the whole deal and got the Manager for us. CON 2 The Manager stated same thing, I showed him our Comformation from Choice and he gave us the rates we booked. Under the Choice booking and our spec-rate we were able under the Booking to extend up to 7 days at the same rate, This did not happen the Manager would not Honor our request for one extra night thru our Choice Program. He did however state the room was open if we wanted to pay as a walk in client at a Higher rate. almost 3 times higher than our booking rate. I think from reviews here and other webs This is a common trick this Hotel uses. Choice NEEDS to Review there Status. Our room was in the back of Hotel ground floor. Our room was not the clean room you would expect. There was a Hairball in the Tub Drain stopping it up so when showering it did not drain. Staff did respond and clear the drain.quickly I might add. Our sheets were Stained and smelled, They appeared to had been washed but still smelled. Room service DOES knock early like at 7 am so use the DND sign on the door if you want to sleep in. PROS Short of the Manager, All Staff we dealt with were Friendly Smiled and Housekeeping was pleasant also . I would not book this Hotel again due to there Booking and and up-rate Scams. We would sleep on a park Bench before getting ripped off. Rumors: We heard From Staff that this Hotel will close in April 2008. I would expect Service will decline as time nears. Cabs from Keywest Airport to Comfort Inn 2 people $11.00 + a tip Not too bad at all. Cabs However to oldtown range a lot more. We rode the City Bus system to old keywest, use the Green. blue and Red lines Only downfall is last bus out of old town is just after 10PM,Cabs cost a avg. of 20 bucks per person if you elect to stay later . The Bus-stop just in front of Comfot Inn is the Orange line, You will need to walk 5-6 blocks just past Hwy 1 to the stop in Front of the VA Clinic to catch the blue, green and red lines. keywest City Bus System is in the middle of changing there routes at this time look them up on the web and print out a current route system if you plan to use there services. There costs are .50 cents for Seniors and a $1.00 for others at this time. Cheap way to get around keywest ! and the A/C works great on there Buses.

Reviews.Title: “Dirt Hole”
Reviews.Author: jzcrna
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd worst hotel I have ever stayed in, and certainly the worst comfort inn. On arrival, it was pouring rain. I entered the motel lobby, and water was pouring through the ceiling. There was a delay with checking in, because the computers were down. Since I booked this through Hotwire, my room was about a half mile from the office and it was a stale, smelly smoking room. Ihad to walk up about twenty steep cement steps to get to my room. It was like a Mayan Temple. Housekeeping did not come until 4pm the first day, and then woke me up at 0730 the next day wanting to clean. It seemed like the housekeeping staff was always on break. The Pros: The contintental breakfast area was clean, food was poor as is always the case with a continental breakfast cheap packaged muffins, and danishes. Hard boiled eggs anyone? I didn't chance it. There was a computer available, but it was infected with viruses and not working properly. Bed and Breakfast on Duval street for me the next time. Ahhhh!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fun and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: obsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May 2007 and the hotel was great. We actually used points for our stay so the value to us was great!
