The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Gave us good information about scooters vs. bikes. There is a rental kiosk in the parking lot adjacent to the hotel. We rented bikes and there are sidewalks almost all the way into the Old Town so you can stay off the sidewalks - sure beats riding a scooter and competing with the auto traffic - plus you get some exercise. Our room was very clean, comfortable and cool. Decor was a little mis-matched but we were not there to enjoy our hotel decor. We requested a 1st floor room near the pool and got just what we wanted. The pool is huge and nicely heated. Kids would love the pool. The breakfast was good - make you own waffles, cereal and breads. We enjoyed eating on the outside patio with the chickens and tropical foilage. Definately a good place in Key West, especially for a family. Rates at times seem a bit high but that is Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money at this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisaj1962
Reviews.Content: This place is filthy. I agree with the post that asked why Choice Hotels would want their name associated with this property. I registered a formal complaint with Choice, who turned it over to the local hotel, and am still waiting for a resolution from the local hotel...almost a month later. I am not a neat freak or anything, but this place was absolutely filthy. The bottoms of my feet were totally BLACK just from walking on the carpet. I wear shoes all of the time, so the only place they were off was in the actual room, so I know this is where the filth came from on my feet. I had to wash them twice prior to getting into bed. The doors did not close properly, the locks were very old and did not seem secure at all. The toilet ran constantly, rather loudly. There were nasty looking stains on the undersides of the bedspreads...didn't want to know what they were...yuck! On and on and on....just a terrible place to stay. We had two rooms, one for us and one for our teens. Both were nasty, so it wasn't just a fluke with one of the rooms. If we had not gone sight-seeing as soon as we checked in, we would have checked out and left without even sleeping there. We did leave early the next morning and went and found another hotel on the island instead. I am a Choice Hotel member, and was thoroughly disgusted by this particular property. DO NOT waste your money on this one!

Reviews.Title: “A Satisfying Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeannecfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn, Key West April 19 - April 21, 2007. I am a single mom who travelled with two teenagers. I was a little leery about booking here after reading some of the negative reviews, but I needn't have worried! Our room was sparkling clean, and the grounds were well maintained. All of the hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful from the second we checked in. Our continental breakfast was terrific. We all especially enjoyed the wonderful waffles and boiled eggs. It was great enjoying our breakfast out on the tropical patio, and watching the roosters frolic around at our feet. I really liked the location of this hotel. It is just over the bridge into Key West and very convenient to stores and reasonably priced restaurants. Right next door is a shop where you can rent motor scooters and also pick up some refreshments and souvenirs for a much cheaper price than you will find on Duval Street. I urge you to rent a scooter, and see the island that way. Discount coupons are available in the hotel lobby. It is much easier to find parking for scooters, and you don't have to worry about parking meters. A caveat to all Florida travellers: some of the negative reviews specifically mentioned mold and foreign speaking personnel. I'm a Floridian....mold & mildew is a fact of life in the tropics and you'll find it in 5 star hotels (we had NO mold or mildew in our room at the Comfort Inn, by the way). Florida has a large population of foreign workers; it should certainly not be a basis for complaint. The hotel's front desk was always staffed with english speaking people. All in all, a wonderful stay at a hotel that was reasonably priced (for the keys)!!

Reviews.Title: “"OK"”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeHoosier
Reviews.Content: Not great, not terrible. Waffle Iron available as part of the free breakfast. Rooms and building could use a renovation. None of the rooms face the water and the property is located across the street from the water. Like I said, not terrible, not great. I've stayed in better Choice Hotels. I only slept and ate the free breakfast here one night. I was in Key West for maybe 12 hours. I probably spent more time driving to Key West from West Palm Beach than I did on the key. But the hotel served its business purpose. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but”
Reviews.Author: TOG11
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel located on the strip. The hotel is showing its age though it is fairly well maintained. I got a good rate and would stay again at the good rate. The continental breakfast is good. They have a very nice outdoor pool and they have a deal with the Radisson next door for use of their pool. My kid truly loved the pool next door.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 3824 N. Roosevelt Blvd., Key West, FL 33040
